questions.question_text: When a user wants to utilize their existing per-socket, per-core, or per-virtual machine software licenses for a Microsoft Windows server running on AWS, which Amazon EC2 instance type is required?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Dedicated Hosts

"An Amazon EC2 Dedicated Host is a physical server with EC2 instance capacity fully dedicated to your use. Dedicated Hosts allow you to use your existing per-socket, per-core, or per-VM software licenses, including Windows Server, Microsoft SQL Server, SUSE, and Linux Enterprise Server."

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/WindowsGuide/dedicated-hosts-overview.html

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/WindowsGuide/dedicated-hosts-overview.html

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer.

questions.question_text: Which AWS Support plan includes infrastructure event management at no additional cost?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The answer is for sure : C 

https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/ 

Infrastructure Event Management comparison: 
Developer: 
- Access to Support Automation Workflows with prefixes AWS Support 

Business : 
- Access to Infrastructure Event Management for additional fee 
- Access to Support Automation Workflows with prefixes AWS Support and AWS Premium Support 

Enterprise: 
- Infrastructure Event Management
- Access to proactive reviews, workshops, and deep dives
- Access to Support Automation Workflows with prefixes AWS Support and AWS Premium Support

Selected Answer: C
C. AWS Enterprise Support

Selected Answer: C
C - Enterprise. Plan
https://us-east-1.console.aws.amazon.com/support/plans/home?region=us-east-1#/

Selected Answer: C
Link to explanation.https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/programs/iem/#:~:text=The%20program%20is%20included%20in%20the%20Enterprise%20Support%20plan%20and%20is%20available%20to%20Business%20Support%20customers%20for%20an%20additional%20fee.

Selected Answer: C
C is the answer.

https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/plans/

Selected Answer: C
Just C

Selected Answer: C
Answer C

Selected Answer: C
should be C

Selected Answer: C
This has to be C, Enterprise, if we are unable to choose two answers as it would have to mention the lowest level plan to get it for free within the question

questions.question_text:
A developer needs to debug and troubleshoot an application that is experiencing runtime errors. The application is running on microservices architecture on AWS.

Which AWS service should the developer use to troubleshoot the application?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. AWS X-Ray

Selected Answer: D
AWS X-Ray is a service that allows developers to analyze, debug, and trace applications that are composed of multiple microservices.

Selected Answer: D
D is the answer.

Selected Answer: D
D. AWS X-Ray

Analyze and debug modern applications built using microservices and serverless architecture and quantify customer impact

https://aws.amazon.com/xray/

Please Admins, stop selecting wrong answers, this is so irresponsible

Selected Answer: D
D. AWS X-Ray

AWS X-Ray allows developers to troubleshoot and debug production, distributed applications, such as those built using a microservices architecture. It provides an end-to-end view of requests as they travel through the application, and allows developers to identify and debug errors and performance issues.

Selected Answer: D
d x-ray

Selected Answer: D
AWS X-Ray is detailed as "An application performance management service". It helps developers analyze and debug production, distributed applications, such as those built using a microservices architecture. With this, you can understand how your application and its underlying services are performing to identify and troubleshoot the root cause of performance issues and errors. It provides an end-to-end view of requests as they travel through your application, and shows a map of your applicationâ€™s underlying components.

Selected Answer: D
This is D, AWS x-ray

AWS x-ray: Analyze and debug production and distributed applications
AWS Inspector: Automated and continual vulnerability management at scale

Selected Answer: B
B. One or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking and connectivity

"An Availability Zone (AZ) is one or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking, and connectivity in an AWS Region. AZs give customers the ability to operate production applications and databases that are more highly available, fault tolerant, and scalable than would be possible from a single data center. All AZs in an AWS Region are interconnected with high-bandwidth, low-latency networking, over fully redundant, dedicated metro fiber providing high-throughput, low-latency networking between AZs. All traffic between AZs is encrypted."

https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/global-infrastructure/regions_az/

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer.

choices.C: One or more clusters of servers where new workloads can be deployed
choices.A: A location where users can deploy compute storage, database and other select AWS services where no AWS Region currently exists
choices.D: A fast content delivery network (CDN) service that securely delivers data videos applications and APIs to users globally
choices.B: One or more discrete data centers with redundant power, networking and connectivity

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. AWS Well Architected Framework

https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/apn/the-6-pillars-of-the-aws-well-architected-framework/

Selected Answer: D
D is the answer.
